## Getting Data is Easy

<!-- Left Card -->
::: {.card .erddap-card style="padding: 2rem; background-color: #f8f9fa; border-radius: 1rem;"}

### ERDDAP makes it easy to access data

ERDDAP is a data server that gives you a simple, consistent way to download data in the format and the spatial and temporal coverage that you want.

### Humans and machines can use ERDDAP

ERDDAP is a web application with an interface for people to use. It is also a RESTful web service that allows data access directly from any computer program (e.g. Matlab, R, or webpages).

### Make customized maps and graphs

Use ERDDAP to generate `.png` and `.pdf` files on-the-fly from gridded and tabular scientific datasets and insert them directly into webpages.

### Search for datasets

ERDDAP’s search capabilities allow full text searches of the metadata or searches by metadata categories, such as keywords, standard name, and data type.

:::

<details class="erddap-dropdown">
  <summary><strong>Sending a Data Request to ERDDAP</strong></summary>
  <div style="font-size: 1rem;">

  <br>

  <p><strong class="dropdown-heading">The URL specifies your data request</strong><br>
  Your query is sent to ERDDAP in a specially formed URL containing the dataset of interest, a description of how you want the data subsetted or graphed, and the file type you want returned to you.</p>

  <p><strong class="dropdown-heading">ERDDAP or you make the URL</strong><br>
  You may use ERDDAP’s “Data Access” and “Make A Graph” tools to quickly make the URL or bypass the forms by generating the URL by hand or with a computer program or script.</p>

  <p><strong class="dropdown-heading">The URLs take the following form</strong><br>
  <code>
    <span style="color:black;">https://</span><span style="color:#e74c3c;">baseURL</span><span style="color:black;">/</span>
    <span style="color:#27ae60;">datasetID</span><span style="color:black;">.</span>
    <span style="color:#3498db;">fileType</span><span style="color:black;">{</span>
    <span style="color:#f39c12;">?query</span><span style="color:black;">}</span>
  </code>
  </p>

  <ul>
    <li><span style="color:#e74c3c;"><strong>baseURL:</strong></span> to the gridded or tabular dataset</li>
    <li><span style="color:#27ae60;"><strong>datasetID:</strong></span> unique identifier of the dataset of interest</li>
    <li><span style="color:#3498db;"><strong>fileType:</strong></span> specifies the type of data file that you want</li>
    <li><span style="color:#f39c12;"><strong>query:</strong></span> specify how you want the dataset subsetted</li>
  </ul>
</div>
</details>
